name: Radio
description: The Radio component is shown as a circle that is filled (checked) when activated.

props.name: value
props.doc: Defines the `value` as a string. Use it to get the value during the `on_change` event listener callback in the **RadioGroup**.

props.name: name
props.doc: Custom grouping name. Defaults to a random name.

props.name: layout_direction
props.doc: Define the layout direction of the Radio buttons. Can be either `column` or `row`. Defaults to `column`.

props.name: size
props.doc: The size of the Radio button. For now there is **medium** (default) and **large**.

props.name: status
props.doc: Text with a status message. The style defaults to an error message. You can use `true` to only get the status color, without a message.

props.name: status_state
props.doc: Defines the state of the status. It's two statuses `[error, info]`. Defaults to `error`.

props.name: status_props
props.doc: Use an object to define additional FormStatus properties.

props.name: label
props.doc: Use either the `label` property or provide a custom one.

props.name: label_direction
props.doc: To define the `label` layout direction on how the next element should be placed on. Can be either `vertical` or `horizontal`. Defaults to `horizontal`.

props.name: label_sr_only
props.doc: Use `true` to make the label only readable by screen readers.

props.name: vertical
props.doc: Will force both `direction` and `label_direction` to be **vertical** if set to `true`.

props.name: checked
props.doc: Determine whether the radio is checked or not. Default will be `false`.

props.name: group
props.doc: Use a unique group identifier to define the Radio buttons that belongs together.

props.name: label_position
props.doc: Defines the position of the `label`. Use either `left` or `right`. Defaults to `right`.

props.name: innerRef
props.doc: By providing a React.ref we can get the internally used input element (DOM). E.g. `innerRef={myRef}` by using `React.createRef()` or `React.useRef()`.

events.name: on_change
events.doc: Will be called once a Radio button changes the state. Returns an object `{ value, event }`.
